change.item: List of recordings in series V was added by Heather Mulliner and finding aid was for edited for compliance with DACS and Tamiment Required Elements for Archival Description by David Olson

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: The Metropolitan Council on Housing was formed in 1959. Veteran housing activists associated with the left (notably the American Labor Party and the Communist Party) played a prominent role; these included Esther Rand and Jane Benedict, longtime MCH leaders. MCH has fought for increased public housing, the maintenance of rent control, and other housing priorities, using a range of tactics that included rent strikes and lobbying. The records contain subject and administrative files, and include clippings, correspondence, minutes and other internal documents, press releases, reports, printed ephemera, government documents, audiocassettes and videocassettes. NOTE: This collection is housed offsite and advance notice is required for use.
did.physloc: Materials stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@library.nyu.edu at least two business days prior to research visit.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Metropolitan Council on Housing (New York, N.Y.).

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Materials were donated by the Metropolitan Council on Housing in 1995, 2002, and 2008. Preliminary inventories were drafted in 2002 and 2008, which served as the basis for an online guide published in 2009. Sometime before 2007, some audio materials were separated from the collection. In 2013, the separated audio materials were returned to the collection, rehoused, and described. Four unrelated cassettes, including dubbed versions of commercial music recordings, were deaccessioned.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: Donated by Metropolitan Council on Housing, 1995, 2002, 2008.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Metropolitan Council on Housing was formed in 1959. Veteran housing activists associated with the left, notably the American Labor Party and the Communist Party played a prominent role, including Esther Rand and Jane Benedict, longtime MCH leaders. MCH has fought for increased public housing, the maintenance of rent control, and other housing priorities, using a variety of tactics, including rent strikes and lobbying. MCH is a membership organization, and also has chapters based on buildings. MCH publishes The Tenant/Inquilinoand hosts a radio program on WBAI, "Listen to Housing Notebook." The organization's website is: http://www.metcouncil.net/ (accessed June 18, 2007).

list.item: Ronald Lawson, ed. The Tenant Movement in New York City, 1904-1984(New Brunswick, N.J.: Rutgers University Press, 1986).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The records, unprocessed as of this writing, contain subject and administrative files, and include clippings, correspondence, minutes and other internal documents, press releases, reports, printed ephemera, government documents, audiocassettes and videocassettes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed. Series one and two are arranged alphabetically; the folders in series three are in the order in which they were received (no apparent system of arrangement); series four is arranged alphabetically within each box
The files are grouped into four series:

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material at the Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
relatedmaterial.p: Roland Lawson Papers (Tamiment 214), relating to the history of New York Metropolitan Area housing issues and tenant activism.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date; Metropolitan Council on Housing Records; TAM 173; box number; folder number;
Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012
Phone: (212) 998-2630
Fax: (212) 995-4225
E-mail: tamiment.wagner@library.nyu.edu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This series includes executive board minutes, documents relating to MCH's workshops, its annual assemblies and conferences, and to the MCH Community Improvement Fund, files relating to housing code enforcement and fuel cost pass-along, and queries from tenants and tenant groups.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This series contains files relating to Columbia University and its relations with Morningsiders United, Mitchell-Lama and other public housing, the National Tenants Organization, New York State housing legislation and related lobbying efforts, rent control and rent stabilization, the Unity Party, Tenant Unity Day, urban renewal, and warehousing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This series contains subject and administrative files relating to the themes covered in Series I and II, and files on Met Council's radio program on WBAI, including audiocassettes of interviews, MCH branch and building organizations and other tenant organizations, including the Cooper Square Committee, East Side Tenants Council, and the Riverside Edgecombe Neighborhood Association, the Neighborhood Preservation Program, squatters, files about Jane Benedict and Esther Rand, and some Spanish language tenant materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This series contains subject and administrative files relating to the themes covered in Series I and II; topics and organizations most prominently represented include the Division of Housing and Community Renewal, rent control and rent stabilization, co-op conversions, and lobbying activity in Albany, New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The majority of the materials in this series are recordings of Jane Benedict's radio program "Tenants Fight For Survival," which was broadcast on WBLS.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Metropolitan Council on Housing audio materials that came to the repository between 2002 and 2007 can be found in Series III, box 27.
